Asie-online

Asie-online

The brief.

The brief was to improve the image and branding of the French travel website Asie-online while improving the user experience and reservation process. Asie-online offers a great quality of service but unfortunately, their old looking website and bloated user experience result in the loss of many of their customers.

Context

Competitors

Created in the late 20's Asie-online was as many websites of that time unconscious about user experience, their main goal was to increase profit through good SEO and many calls to action on their pages. But time has changed and nowadays customers are used to the simple yet efficient user flow offered by companies such as Uber or Airbnb.

Bloated user experience

The pages of Asie-online features some problematic elements. Poor contrast and a lack of general legibility, too many calls to action resulting from the user being lost and many other Ux flaws.

Brand image

As for the Ux, there were many problems with the brand's image. The old looking red and poor quality visuals gave the impression of low-quality services and old fashioned trips.

Research & UX

I started by doing a site map to analyze the site hierarchy in overflow. It appeared that the main user flows are a bit complicated but not too much, but besides that many other paths were really long and confusing for the user.

The UI suffered many problems, lack of contrast on some elements, badly organized content without breathing space.

Form design

One big problem of the old website was the really long form needed to get an estimation of the cost of travel. It was long and it looked long to the user which was making the conversion rate drop.

Better designed forms directly on the landing page would allow new customers to quickly try to build a custom trip. To do so I designed a set of visual inputs easier and more affording than standard form elements ( but still based on standard HTML for controls ).

Landing page & CTAs

Most of the work was to reorganize the landing page in order to make it more appealing and less crowded. I divided it into meaningful sections each with only one or two main calls to actions. This provides clear and easy to spot ways of interaction with the service offered by the website.

UI design & branding

I used Sketch to build high fidelity mockups of the new website. The old looking dimmed red was replaced by a more vibrant one.

The biggest visual change was the choice of the images, previously images looked low quality by the lack of unity in the website. I chose high-quality pictures and even more important ones with a coherent style.

For typography only two were picked, both free font from google fonts but I chose them to be looking different from types used in a word or libre office as for many people they look cheap.

A simple yet efficient typographical contrast allow separating titles from copy text.

The use of white-space, subtle color contrast and patterns contribute to give to the new site a more modern and premium look.

The final result

The final result was satisfying from a visual design point of view and the UX was improved compared to the old website. The only regret I have about this project was the lack of time because the interfaces remain untested yet and I am curious to see how real visitors would behave.
